entries.node_behavior: process.binding() exposes internal C++ bindings, allowing unrestricted access to Node internals.
entries.franken_behavior: process.binding() is disabled by default. Returns a structured error with policy-gate information. Available only in legacy-risky mode with explicit policy opt-in.
entries.rationale: process.binding() bypasses all security boundaries and trust controls. Disabling it by default aligns with the impossible-by-default security model. Legacy applications requiring this behavior must explicitly opt in via policy configuration.

entries.node_behavior: vm.runInNewContext() creates a new V8 context and executes arbitrary code with configurable sandbox.
entries.franken_behavior: vm.runInNewContext() executes under franken_engine's sandboxed execution model with mandatory capability restrictions. Full V8 context isolation semantics are not replicated; instead, franken_engine provides deterministic execution boundaries.
entries.rationale: V8 context isolation has known escape vectors. franken_engine's native sandboxing provides stronger guarantees. Behavioral differences are documented and produce divergence receipts at runtime.
